title: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site: Partners
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Partners            Partners       Western National Parks Association Western National Parks Association (WNPA) is a nonprofit organization assisting the National Park Service in its educational, interpretive and scientific programs throughout the southwest United States.  Known as a "cooperating association", WNPA's goals include enhancing visitors' understanding and appreciation of public lands by providing a selection of quality, educational materials for sale in many visitor centers,  A percentage of these sales is returned to the National Park Service.  WNPA operates the bookstore at the rear of the fort.            Santa Fe Trail Association The mission of the Santa Fe Trail Association is to protect and preserve the Santa Fe Trail and to promote awareness of the historical legacy associated with it.  Bent's Old Fort figured predominately in the history of the Santa Fe Trail.  The SFTA has supported the park's special events in may ways.         Canyon and Plains of Southeast Colorado Canyons and Plains (C&P) is a heritage tourism development organization.  Formed in 2003, C&P serves seven counties - Baca, Bent, Crowley, Kiowa, Otero, Prowers, and eastern Las Animas.  C&P promotes visitation to and stewardship of the unique historical, natural and cultural assets of southeastern Colorado among resident, state, national, and international audiences.  The organization, a 501(C)(3) nonprofit comprised of numerous local, state and federal partners has, thus far, garnered over $1 million in funding for heritage development and stewardship in the region.
